intro: Hibbertia lucens, commonly known as the golden hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows as a shrub with hairy, ribbed stems and oval-shaped leaves. Its flowers are tubular and have five spreading lobes, often with a distinctive orange or red hue at the base. Hibbertia lucens is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to full sun exposure.
